intro: Brachionidium, commonly known as the water flea, is a genus of tiny, free-living freshwater crustaceans. These organisms are part of the order Cladocera and are typically less than 1 millimeter in length. They possess a distinctive, shield-like carapace that covers their body and provides protection. Brachionidium species are known for their rapid reproduction and are often found in ponds, lakes, and other still water environments. They play an important role in aquatic ecosystems as both prey and indicators of water quality.
